Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: The creature attacks with its mouth, dealing piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage.

Breath Weapon (Cone).name: Breath Weapon (Cone)
Breath Weapon (Cone).description:
A creature attacking with a breath weapon is actually expelling something from its mouth (rather than conjuring it by means of a spell or some other magical effect). A breath weapon attack usually deals damage and is often based on some type of energy.

Such breath weapons allow a Reflex save for half damage (DC 10 + 1/2 breathing creature’s racial HD + breathing creature’s Con modifier; the exact DC is given in the creature’s descriptive text). Some breath weapons allow a Fortitude save or a Will save instead of a Reflex save. Most creatures with breath weapons are limited to a number of uses per day or by a minimum length of time that must pass between uses. Such creatures are usually smart enough to save their breath weapon until they really need it.

  • Using a breath weapon is typically a standard action.
  • No attack roll is necessary. The breath simply fills its stated area.
  • Any character caught in the area must make the appropriate saving throw or suffer the breath weapon’s full effect. In many cases, a character who succeeds on his saving throw still takes half damage or some other reduced effect.
  • Breath weapons are supernatural abilities except where noted.
  • Creatures are immune to their own breath weapons unless otherwise noted.
  • Creatures unable to breathe can still use breath weapons. (The term is something of a misnomer.)

Breath Weapon (Ray).name: Breath Weapon (Ray)
Breath Weapon (Ray).description:

Some breath weapons allow a Fortitude save or a Will save instead of a Reflex save. Most creatures with breath weapons are limited to a number of uses per day or by a minimum length of time that must pass between uses. Such creatures are usually smart enough to save their breath weapon until they really need it.

  • Using a breath weapon is typically a standard action.
  • No attack roll is necessary. The breath simply fills its stated area.
  • Any character caught in the area must make the appropriate saving throw or suffer the breath weapon’s full effect. In many cases, a character who succeeds on his saving throw still takes half damage or some other reduced effect.
  • Breath weapons are supernatural abilities except where noted.
  • Creatures are immune to their own breath weapons unless otherwise noted.
  • Creatures unable to breathe can still use breath weapons. (The term is something of a misnomer.)

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: The creature rips with a sharp appendage, dealing piercing and slashing damage.

Gore.name: Gore
Gore.description: The creature spears the opponent with an antler, horn, or similar appendage, dealing piercing damage.

Hoof.name: Hoof
Hoof.description: The creature attacks with its hoof, dealing bludgeoning damage.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: The creature batters opponents with an appendage, dealing bludgeoning damage.

Slap.name: Slap
Slap.description: The creature batters opponents with an appendage, dealing bludgeoning damage.

Sting.name: Sting
Sting.description: The creature stabs with a stinger, dealing piercing damage. Sting attacks usually deal damage from poison in addition to hit point damage.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: The creature attacks with its tail, dealing bludgeoning damage.

Talon.name: Talon
Talon.description: The creature rips with a sharp appendage, dealing piercing and slashing damage.

Wing.name: Wing
Wing.description: The creature attacks with its wings, dealing bludgeoning damage.
